hadiths.english_translation: Biographical entry: Muqal ibn Ubaidullah - a freed slave of a woman from Kindah from Bani Adi. His kunyah (patronymic) is Abu Muhammad al-Kufi. He heard from Abu Jahifah and saw Zaid ibn Arqam. Shu'bah and Mansur heard from him. Abu Nu'aym said he died in the year 115 AH. Muhammad ibn Mahbub said, from Quraish ibn Anas, that he died in the year 113 AH. Ibn Abi Ghaniyyah said his kunyah is Abu Abdullah. Yahya al-Qattan said that Shu'bah said: al-Hakam, from Mujahid, in writing except what he said 'I heard'. According to some genealogists: al-Hakam ibn Utaybah ibn an-Nuhhas, whose name was Abdal, from Bani Sa'd ibn Ajal ibn Lujayy - I do not know if he preserved (the hadith) or not.

chainIssues: Biographical entry rather than hadith chain
Discrepancies in reported death year (113 vs 115 AH)
Genealogy uncertain with notation 'I do not know if he preserved (the hadith) or not'
This appears to be a biographical dictionary entry rather than a complete hadith transmission chain

potential_issues.issue: Entry is biographical in nature rather than a hadith with complete transmission chain
potential_issues.impact: Cannot properly classify as marfu', mawquf, or maqtu' - lacks clear hadith text

potential_issues.issue: Multiple conflicting reports about death year (113 AH vs 115 AH)
potential_issues.impact: Inconsistent biographical data suggests possible manuscript variations or confusion between individuals

potential_issues.issue: Note 'I do not know if he preserved (the hadith) or not' indicates uncertainty about reliability
potential_issues.impact: Explicit acknowledgment of uncertainty about this narrator's reliability

potential_issues.issue: No clear hadith text (matn) provided
potential_issues.impact: Cannot assess textual transmission or meaning

Topics: Biographical information about narrator Muqal ibn Ubaidullah

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubaidah: Abd al-Samad told us, saying: Dailam al-'Attar al-Abdi told us, saying: al-Hakam ibn Jahl told me, saying: Umm al-Karam told me, saying: She performed pilgrimage and met a woman in Makkah, who said: 'My grandfather was with the Prophet ﷺ and I was with him, and upon me were two gold earrings, and the Prophet ﷺ said: Two flames of fire.' Abu Asim al-Abbadani heard from him.
